page.title: 14Birdlife on the Eyebrook
page.content: The Eyebrook reservoir is an attractive habitat for a wide variety of bird life. Although small in comparison with Rutland Water, much of it is relatively undisturbed,save by fishermen,particularly at the northern end where the largest flocks of wildfowl usually congregate.Resident species include{moorhen,coot,tufted {duck,great crested grebe,mallard,teal, {and canada geese}The surrounding fields. hedges and woods are home for many{finches,buntings,sparrows,larks, {pigeon thrushes,titmice,wrens and {dunnocks.}Gulls are always present on the water, often in very large flocks. Black{headed gulls and lesser black {backs}are the most common feeding on the nearby fields by day.{Waders {include redshank}and{snipe;lapwings are always abundant. .
